Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2008 05:50AM sparker38 wrote: Emma and Heather, my prayers are with you as you go on this journey of the unknown.  I started my journey in Oct 2007.  Found a lump while taking a bath.  I am still in shock over the diagnosis but I am enduring all that has come my way.  Mammo, ultrasound, biopsy, left breast massectomy, lymph node removal and now hair loss due to chemo therapy.  Six down and two more to go.  Even if you do get the diagnosis remember it's not the end.  It's never over until God says it is.  Strengthen your faith at this point and believe that know matter what the Dr's may say there is a higher physician that can turn things around.  Emma yes we forget sometimes and look at the problem and not the problem solver but hey we are human and he knows that.  Speak those things as though they are.  By Jesus stripes you are healed.  And no weapon formed against me shall prosper.  What the enemy means for bad God changes it for the good.  So what ever you are going through right now it will strengthen you and your faith in so many ways.  Whether its bc or not know now your fight begins.  It is only for a season.  And know you are not alone.  I love this site.  If it wasn't for the people I have meet through here I don't know where I would be.  Keep posted with your updates and we all will be praying for you Your sister sparker
Posts.Title: fear of possible bc diagnosis Emma56 Emma56

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2008 10:54AM sparker38 wrote: Hey Barb, This is the day, This is the day, That the Lord has made, I will rejoice, I will rejoice,  and be glad in it.  Chemo is doable... Just let that red blood of Jesus run through them veins.  I hope it all goes well.  I know it will all go well.  Take care and get plenty of rest Love, Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2008 03:36PM sparker38 wrote: On hold and it sucks.  We are getting hit with so much snow my husband can't even make it out to work. Damn, Damn, Damn.  Need that money.  It's horrible outside they said 8-12 inches and it looks as though we are getting every inch of it.  The kids are even home from school today no peace for me.  So far they have rescheduled me for Friday weather permitting.  Which means the weekend I might be feeling like crap.  The Dr's office will be closed on Sat so I don't know what they are going to do about my day after shot.  They said I might not have to take it anymore anyway.  Yes ducky AC/C and now Taxol.  Four hours of that stuff sucks.  Hooked up to blood pressure cup going off every 15 minutes and a heart machine.  And the nurse watching your every move for side affects.  But that Benadry before the chemo man did that scare the mess out of me.  I was higher than a kite.  I felt that crap moving through my system I freaked out.  I can see why drug addicts are addicts.  But who in the heck wants to feel like that.  I asked them to not give it to me anymore but they said they have to.  It helps with the side effects of the chemo drug.  I was so high that I  couldn't even go to sleep that night I was still high.  from my jaws to my head I kept feeling this buzzing feeling.  I remember trying to smoke weed when I was a teen.  I didn't like the way I felt all goofy, smiling when I didn't know why, thinking I had the munchies, I didn't like feeling that way so I stopped.  And here I am getting high again this time not by choice.  Well Barb I am glad you are resting, give it a few days you will be back running it again.  Stay on top of the nausea so that I don't get too bad and you're barfing all over.  Snack on the crackers.  Drink plenty of fluids and pee, pee, pee. Take care love ya Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2008 10:12AM sparker38 wrote: p.s.  Do any of you go into the chat room? Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2008 04:35AM - edited Feb 13, 2008 04:36AM by sparker38 Hey all, Barb, yeah don't even sweat it.  Believe me we all have been there and still are going through it.  I had chemo on Friday and Nuelasta shot on Monday and the pain I am feeling right now ain't no joke. (forgive my bad english).  Bone and joint pain.  Every time I move my bones just pop.  I was up until 4:30 this morning with pain and couldn't sleep.  Popping percocetes and aleve.  My stomach is a garbage can for drugs.  My abdominals feels like a pin cushion.  I hate taking pills but I have to to get through this pain.  I am a very quiet person and keep my feelings to myself most of the time but if I let loose and tell you how this crap really makes me feel.  Let's say I might just loose my religion.  So honey when you feel you gotta go there let it rip.  Then relaxe...relate...release...  And know that this is only for a season. Take care all Sabrina P.S.  Anyone have any special plans for Valentines Day?
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2008 10:36AM - edited Feb 19, 2008 10:38AM by sparker38 Test...Test...This is only a Test...I would like to interupt this blog for a minute.  This journey is only here to Test your Faith...Stand...Stand...Stand...And after you have done all you can Stand...He will not give you more than you can stand...For this too shall pass...Hold on change is coming...Hold on every thing will be alright...Hold on you can make...I just can't give up now, I've come to far from where I started from, Know body told me the road would be easy, and I don't believe he brought me this far to leave me... I will lift up my eyes to the hills from which comes my help...my help comes from the Lord...the one who made heaven and earth.  He said he would not sufer my foot, my foot to be moved.  the lord that keepeth me, he will not slumber nor sleep.  The lord is my keeper upon thy right hand.  My help, my help, all of my help comes from the Lord.  Lord show me your face, I'm longing for your presence to fill this place, I give you all the pieces, cause you made me a promise, you'de put me back together better than I was before.  Lord show me your will until you do I promise that I'll be still, so come and take these pieces you made me a promise, said you'de put me back together better than I was before.  So much better, old things passed away.  I am better than I was before.... Weaping may endureth for a night...But joy comes in the morning. Barb have a great day!!! love Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2007 02:41AM sparker38 wrote: Hello barbara I know through this thing you feel like you are the only one that feels this way until you find a site like this and you don't know what you are going to find out.  Yes there is someone just like you, feeling just like you, numb just like you, not shocked just like you, confused just like you but believing that God and his will will be done through all of this.  Because as believers we know that through his stripes we are healed.  And that no weapon formed against us shall prosper.  Yes that someone just like you is me.  Speak to those mountains and tell them to move.  If you are going to worry don't pray.  If you are going to pray don't worry.  Is what I was told.  Claim your healing in the name of Jesus.  I know that is easier said than done.  And I want to have faith that all I have said is sooo true.  But I am still working on my faith.  But I have to keep confessing it so that it will get into my heart.  Not just my mind.  My sister in-law is an elder in her church and has really been a God send to me.  She is a prayer warrior.  She has litterally given her self over to my recovery.  She has been here praying me through dx, surgeries, everyday she came by and emptied my drains twice a day, and came to milk my tubes 4 times.  She doesn't work right now because she has went into full time ministry.  But she believe God released her from her job for such a time as this.  And through me her faith has become stronger.  I know others who might read this might say what the heck is she talkin bout.  But I know you know what I mean.  Right now I am thinking about cutting off my hair and going wig shopping because I start chemo on the 28th of Nov.  But she is believing that if I believe and ask God for my hair not to fall out then it won't.  I've prayed but it hasn't gotten into my heart yet.  So to be prepared I am going wig shopping next week.  lol...seems crazy don't it. Well sister all I want to say is that keep your faith and lean not onto your own understanding but stand by the word.  You not being upset is just the peace of God on you.  And know that you have another person standing in agreement with you that you are blessed and not cursed.  By the way milk that husband for what it is worth.  Let him spoil you rotten. I think my husband has cried more tears than I could ever cry. We have been together since we were 14yrs old.  First to see my boobs and last to see it go.  I have two children 12 and 15 that truely adores me.  So I know I have and will win this fight.  Please know that you have a friend in me if ever you need to talk and pray.  I am here for you May God bless you and keep you love your sister, sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2008 01:46AM sparker38 wrote: Yeah Barb, thats the strangeness of this whole thing.  Every one's dx and treatment is so different.  One moment I read that DCIS is not cancer and doesn't need chemo treatments.  Then I have people asking me why just chemo that I should be getting radiation too.  I don't know.  I guess you just have to trust and believe what your physician has set up for you is the best tx there is.  And know and pray that we have a higher physician that knows best.  So I try not to get caught up in to what everyones else tx are and dx compared to mine.  It is to dang confusing.  Chemo brain has me confused enough.  I went to the pharmacy the other day to refill a prescription but one had no more refills so she asked me what was my physcians name and yes I totally forgot.  She had to look it up in the computer.  I couldn't do anything but laugh.  She said she was laughing with me not at me.  One thing I noticed during my first round of chemo AC that my hands turned really black.  My nail beds have turned black.  And the bottom of my feets are black.  I asked my onc about it he says it's just pigmentation.  Has anyone had to deal with that at all?  It freaked me out at first.  They look like now they are getting lighter. Barb have you joined any support groups in your area yet?  Or do you feel the need to?  I haven't but I want to.  I recently signed up for the Relay for Life fight against Bc here in my town that going on in May.  I am really looking forward to it.  I have been in the past as a spectator and it is truely an emotional event.  But this time I will be participating in it as a survivor.  MY MY MY how life takes you for a loop.  Who'd a thought me a cancer survivor.  Yes I am naming it and claiming it.  Well you all have a blessed day Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2008 05:40PM sparker38 wrote: I always thought that the winter was better for fighting of germs.  The colder the better.  That is why surgery rooms are always so cold. Barb, before your next treatment won't you be giving blood test to see if your white blood count is up for you to be able to chemo.  I always have blood work done the day before chemo.  Or an hour before.  They have always come back ok.  I don't think they would give you chemo with you being sick still.  And most of the information I have posted at the bottom of my post is information from my pathology report.  Take it in and have him highlight the answers to the questions you have.  Tell him to explain it to you like you are a two year old.  I think on this site there is a place on here that helps you read your pathology report. Well I am having a sweet tooth and it is cold and rainy, snowy, and icy outdoors and there is nothing in my cabinets quick to fix.  So I am going to surf the net for a recipe to come up with something.  So far I found a loaf of french bread in my freezer.  Anybody have a good recipe for bread pudding? Have a great day sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2008 10:27AM sparker38 wrote: Barb, Good morning and good luck on getting your answers. Two more days till treatment and i am just getting over the last treatment.  Still having spasms though.  And under my arm is starting to bother more.  It keeps swelling up where the tubes were takin out of.  And my arm and back is numb sometimes from the lymphdema.  He mentioned to me about physical therapy but didn't follow up at the end of appt.  So I will be bringing it up again.  And hopefully getting a sleeve for this arm.  I don't want to walk around with a big chunky arm.  And I have enough flab under my arms to add to it.  A Few more weeks and this will all be over.  Can't wait. Question?  You are already taking Tamoxifen?  I don't start taking that until after chemo.  For five years.  Isn't that for your hormones? Like I said everyones tx is so different. Well I am glad you guys are having nice weather.  Here we are still under snow.  However the sun is shining outside.  But don't let it fool ya.  We had cold and rain yesterday so everything is iced up.  I slept under two blankets last night.  Until the hot flashes started to hit again.  Those things are the pits. Well I hope you have a truely blessed day.  And that you get better soon. love ya sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2008 10:27AM - edited Feb 18, 2008 10:29AM by sparker38

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2008 12:15AM sparker38 wrote: Hey, Barbara Now I see where you hang out.  Check your private messages.  I am glad you found you a new dr.  I started my new chemo drug last Wed and yes it kicked my butt.  Taxol...I am still having leg pains and numbness in my feet.  It's getting better.  Didn't help over the weekend when there were no on call oncologist and no one in the emergency room to help with my pain.  Atleast I know now what to look forward to the next three.  Maybe they won't be as bad.  Five down and three to go.  Take care Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2008 07:05AM - edited Mar 14, 2008 07:07AM by sparker38 Hey Bard, Great to see you are taking it all in stride.  I was worried about you.  But i know you are a true "G" just like me.    We can battle with the best of them.  My last tx was last week.  Hip, Hip, Hooray. This last tx really kicked the crap out of me.  Now on to bigger and better things.  I have to start physical therapy for my lymphedema soon as the nurse calls me with my appt.  I don't see the onc again until April 2.  I have to have a bone scan and some hormone test done.  Might be getting the rest of my gutts taken out.  (Ovaries) uterus already gone.  I told him I am tired of all of this medication I am taking. Take out and get rid of anything that is not of use.  My gyn thought I was too young to get them out a few years back when he took my uterus.  Ticked me off.  Either meds for hormone's with ovaries or med's for hormones with out ovaries.  Polycystic ovaries suck.  but anyway's Glad you are doing just fine... So you are already planning your get away.  Please take me with you.  Right now I am so financially challenged that a vacation is so out of the question.  Even a shirt or pants at this point.  But that is ok.  I have never been the type to do something special for myself it's all about everybody else.  Especially my babies.  They always come first.  But I know as I bless others my blessing will soon follow. I have been following Oprah's book club selection and on live web event with Eckhart Tolle's "A New Earth-Awakening to Your Life's Purpose.  I am really getting alot out of it.  This time around I really want to try to do things right.  I know that God has a purpose for me but still trying to find out what it is.  Especially since I am knocking down 40's door. Well for now I'm gonna keep on keepin on. Be blessed, your friend and sister Sabrina.
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2008 09:41AM sparker38 wrote: Hello, just checking in to see how everyone is doing?  Barb where are you at hun??? Been thinking about you.  I guess now that you are feeling better you are off and running?  Good for you.  Well atleast I am hoping that thats the case.  Any ways check in to let us know how you doing.  Chemo for me of course sucked.  Not as bad as the others because I did tried although in lots of pain tried to keep busy and my mind off of it.  Feet are numb and am walking slow.  Pains popping up in places I haven't felt before.  Been seeing alot of post of black nails and nails falling off.  I hope it doesn't happen to me.  Some says the color does come back after tx.  And I am starting to feels some peach fuzz on top of my head.  But in all life is good.  Just waiting for it to be over. Hope to hear from you guys later. Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2008 01:05AM sparker38 wrote: Hey Barb, Yeah the day after chemo you take the neulasta shot.  Thats when the pain for me kicks in.  Bone and joint pain.  It just last a few days though.  I've never had a problem with my white blood count.  And didn't always have the pain.  But when I had it, it kicked rocks.  This last time really sucked.  I could barely walk.  My feet were numb and I had the worst restless leg symdrom I have ever had.  I don't know really if it was the Taxol or the Neulasta they both have similar side effects.  I sent you another email.  And check you bc my profile inbox. Talk  ya later love Sabrina

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2008 08:43PM sparker38 wrote: Hey barb, been thinking about you all day.  I see you made it through.  Like I said relax and take it easy and drink plenty of fluids and keep some crackers on hand for the nausea.  I haven't had a problem with nausea since the first chemo.  I go tomorrow for my blood work and chemo on Wed, neulasta shot on Thursday.  I dread the weeks of chemo but only two more after this.  I will check in here tomorrow to see how you are doing. Take care Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2008 06:06AM sparker38 wrote: Hey, Barb I hate to see you are still fighting the sore throat.  I had it for a few days.  The only magic cure I can think of is Listerine.  My dr had prescribed me the medicine for sore mouth that you are suppose to swish in your mouth and spit out.  But he told me to swallow it.  (cp-maalidoben/lidocaine,maalox,diphen AF).  It didn't taste too bad but it sure numbed my mouth for a few minutes and my throat. I only had to use it a few times.   But anyways things will get better.  Stay encouraged my friend.  And don't give up the fight. Love you Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2008 09:27AM sparker38 wrote: Good morning all...My date with destiny went just fine.  So far so good.  Wasn't able to pick up my boob for we got back to late to get it.  Will be going today to get it and to get my lovely nuelasta shot. One down and one to go.  I am nervous because I don't know whats next.  He did tell me he is going to be taking my port out sooner than I thought he would.  So I suppose he feels that I am ok.  I have to go back every three months for a while for pt scans and mammo's. And blood work.  And start my Tamoxifen for 5 years.  I put my life on hold for 5 months for not knowing what to expect or what to do during tx.  Now it's time to pick back up.  Finding a new job, making better decisions for my life mentally, physically and financially.  As I look back over my life I got a lot of do overs.  I am glad Gods has seen to it that I have another chance to get it right this time.  So please continue to pray for me.  I will still be here writing you guys everyday and looking for some good advice and council.  And to be here for you guys.  I love the friendships I have made on this site.  You guys are my queens.... Take care and have a blessed day Love you all Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2008 10:21AM sparker38 wrote: Too many questions, not enough answers My perfect life, interrupted by cancer Why me, this must be a joke There go my dreams up in smoke Do I give up or do I fight? Am I gonna make it through the night? What's going to happen, do you even know? Do I have to stay here, when do I go home? Well their goes my hair falling to the floor Is this my body waging a war? Will it grow back or will it stay away? And how do I tell my son ‘mommy can't play' Where did the time go, is it really that bad Everyone stares at me with faces so sad Maybe they know something that I don't Sometimes I don't want to answer the phone I want to run away, far from this place I avoid the mirror, who wants to see this face? Days go by where I just stay in bed Other days I wonder what lies ahead Feeling so alone, but surrounded by all Why did God give me this, I feel so small But then one day I see my son's face And remember I'm here by God's loving grace So I run for life, for yours and mine And I won't give up, not this time This is it, it's do or die I'm looking fear right in the eye I'm going to run till my race is through And through it all, know that I love you..." This was a poem I read off another thread I thought it was awesome.  Just wanted to share it with you guys. sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2008 10:29PM sparker38 wrote: Hey barb & ducky, Yeah treatment #6 but from the way things look outside I might have to put this one on hold, we are looking at 8-12 inches of snow by tomorrow and there is no way I will be traveling to that appt.  The dr's office called and told me to call before I come to see if even the dr made it in.  I had my blood work done today so hopefully I won't have to redo that.  I am so ready to get this over with.  Then two more to go.  Then on to five years of Tamoxifen.  And ducky I am with you on the water.  I literally have to force myself to drink the stuff now.  My son and I make a race out of it to see who can drink it the fastest.  For a while everything I drank tasted like chemo.  That metalic taste that comes when they are flusing my port.  I noticed today that I am starting to get some peach fuzz on my head.  I am only noticing the gray strands though but I'll take it. Barb I hope you are taking it easy.  No superwoman antics.  Did you have to take the neulasta shot?  That crap hurts like heck going in so try not to squezze Eugene too hard. Hugs Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2008 09:13PM - edited Feb 8, 2008 09:27PM by sparker38 Maryl, Oh my goodness you hit it right on the nail.  You go gurl...I couldn't have said it better myself.  I remember the night the surgeon called me and said it was cancer.  My son and daughter was sitting next to me on the sofa.  I tried to laugh it off because I didn't want to scare them.  But I couldn't hold it back and I told them.  My 12 year old son just burst into tears my then 15 year old daughter went into shock for a moment.  I took my son outside for a long walk around the neighborhood and told him that he has always been my strong one whenever I needed him and now I really needed him to be strong for me.  We cried together wiped our tears and came back home ready to fight.  Whiled we were gone my daughter had went on the discovery channel and looked up everything on bc for me to look at.  And when I tried I just turned it off couldn't handle it.  Pulled off my shirt and bra layed in my bed grabed my anoiting oil and rubbed all over my breast and prayed to God for my healing.  Pulled out healing scriptures.  The whole evening until 5:30 in the morning I was awake feeling this burning sensation from my head down to my waist.  I thought it was the cancer spreading I was literrally scared to fall asleep because of the burning I was feeling.  It did not dawn on me until the next day when I reflected on the prayers that I had sent up from the shock of the news that it was the healing power of God working in me.  Praise God that by his stripes I am healed.  I have not felt that sensation since that night.  I still confess my healing everyday.  You are right he won't give us more than we can bear.  I just came home from chemo today.  So far I feel ok.  Still high off of the benadryl and dilantin ( i think).  I can't go for my neulasta shot until Monday.  Which might put my chemo back a week if the white blood cells don't work quick in my system.  But I know that they will.  I told him to schedule me as normal.  I will be there.  Two more to go and then PARTAY!!! I do have to see a physical therapist for my arm It is sore and my had is swelling.  Have to get a sleeve for it. As far as journaling I can't bring myself to do it.  I have tried but my mind be so mixed up I can't seem to write stuff down.  I still feel sort of numb through all of this.  Like I am looking from the outside in.  (This is not happening to me).  Or could be chemo brain I am not involved into any cancer groups and I want to so bad.  But no transportation in the evening to get to any.  I signed up for a Reach to Recovery person through the cancer society.  She called me one time.  I called her back to let her know that I was beginning chemo left the message and she has never returned my calls.  I am at the time working on signing up for Relay for Life.  Check out the web site.  I have also sent off for Kormens 3 day walk for the cure in Chicago.  So I am sort of on my own here except for family and friends here that hadn't been affected by this until me.  But they are a blessing.  Here fighting with me all the way.  Praying and standing in the gap. And even though you guys are not here physically I know that you all are with me too.  God Bless you all Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2008 10:12AM sparker38 wrote: Hey guys, just wanted to check in and say hello... Now the antibiotics I don't know about that either but I do know that my dr didn't want to give me any.  I have been fighting this sinus and chest congestion for a while now and he doesn't want to give me any antibotics for it.  Never said why though just that he doesn't want it to interfere with my chemo treatments.  Yeah religion is a hard thing to mention on this board because alot of people are not where you are at when it comes to God, Jesus or whomever there higher power is.  Or if they even have one.  I know that calling on my heavenly father through all things works best for me and I just try my best to share it with others and they can take it or leave it.  Love and hugs to ya all Sabrina
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2008 08:57AM - edited Feb 20, 2008 08:58AM by sparker38 Good morning ladies I am so happy to see you are feeling better Barb.  Praise God... I am getting ready for my date with Mr. Destiny...TAXOL...four hours of pure de unsolicited fun.  (yeah right)  Anyone want to take my place have at it... I am glad you all enjoyed my mixed rap.  It gets me through the good, the bad and the down right ugly times.  do be do be dooo... Oh give thanks unto the Lord, for he is good, for he is good. Oh give thanks unto the Lord, for he is good, for he is good. for he is worthy, worthy, for he is good, yes he is good. yes he is worthy, worthy, for he is good, yes he is good. You all have a blessed day and pray for my strenghth to get through this one unscaved... Love you all sabrina p.s. One down and One more to go...hip, hip, horray!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou
